comment.shortText:
A hook that mirrors `useState` in function and API, expect that setState
calls return a promise that resolves after the state has been set (in an effect).

comment.text: initialize with some state value same as `useState`

mdx.rawBody: initialize with some state value same as `useState`

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: initialize with some state value same as `useState`
markdownRemark.html: initialize with some state value same as useState

A hook that mirrors useState in function and API, expect that setState calls return a promise that resolves after the state has been set (in an effect). This is similar to the second callback in classy setState calls, but fires later.

const [counter, setState] = useStateAsync(1);

const handleIncrement = async () => {
  await setState(2);
  doWorkRequiringCurrentState()
}

tags.name: param
tags.value: initialize with some state value same as `useState`
